thread.title: Whistler turns up adrenaline in the summer
thread.title_full: Whistler turns up adrenaline in the summer - San Francisco Chronicle

author: By Margo Pfeiff
title: Whistler turns up adrenaline in the summer
text:
Photo: Margo Pfeiff, Special To The Chronicle 8330699|article-6402605|7 8330699|article-6402605|1 email_share_embed|photo-8330699|article-6402605|1 8330699|article-6402605|2 8330699|article-6402605|3 8330699|article-6402605|4 8330699|article-6402605|5 google_share_embed|photo-8330699|article-6402605|6 A kayaker paddles the River of Golden Dreams from Alta Lake to Green Lake. A kayaker paddles the River of Golden Dreams from Alta Lake to...
Clusters of baby geese flee across Nita Lake’s mirror surface at sunrise as I teeter toward them on my virgin stand-up paddleboard voyage. Then I grab a bike and cruise the 37-mile-long Valley Trail — spotting a bear in the underbrush — en route to a first-time cliff-climbing escapade via a Via Ferrata. By the time the hot and sunny day comes to a close, I’ve also hiked a mountaintop trail between two towering walls of snow in a T-shirt and canoed Alta Lake, attempting to outwit rainbow and cutthroat trout with a fly fishing rod I just learned to cast. A kayaker paddles the River of Golden Dreams from Alta Lake to Green Lake. A kayaker paddles the River of Golden Dreams from Alta Lake to...
Clusters of baby geese flee across Nita Lake’s mirror surface at sunrise as I teeter toward them on my virgin stand-up paddleboard voyage. Then I grab a bike and cruise the 37-mile-long Valley Trail — spotting a bear in the underbrush — en route to a first-time cliff-climbing escapade via a Via Ferrata. By the time the hot and sunny day comes to a close, I’ve also hiked a mountaintop trail between two towering walls of snow in a T-shirt and canoed Alta Lake, attempting to outwit rainbow and cutthroat trout with a fly fishing rod I just learned to cast.
